title: Ahmed Yousef, former Hamas official: 'We have lost everything, armed struggle has failed'
subhead: A former senior official of Hamas, with whom he has since broken ties, Yousef offers a bleak assessment of two years of war in the Palestinian enclave. Now living in a tent in Gaza, he voices rare criticism among Islamist circles toward Yahya Sinwar, the militant behind the October 7 attack, which he calls a 'fatal mistake.'

title: French former minster Jack Lang summoned to explain Epstein links
Jean-Luc Mélenchon courts small business owners
UK inquiry further incriminates French rescue services in 2021 Channel shipwreck
subhead: The findings of a British public inquiry reveal that French rescue services on November 24, 2021, instructed an oil tanker to continue its course, even though it was likely the ship had located the distressed dinghy in which 31 people perished.

title: France warns of possible 'IS resurgence' in Syria, where 'French citizens' security is also at stake'
subhead: According to Paris, the Syrian authorities' agreement with Kurdish forces challenges the structure of the fight against the jihadist group in Syria and Iraq. On Thursday, France's foreign minister traveled to Damascus, Baghdad and Erbil.

title: Pretzels and Käseküeche: The comforting treasures of Alsatian cuisine
subhead: 'Homemade!' Léo Pajon, our food journalist, visits your kitchens. At Margaux Albrecht's home on the edge of Alsace, he learns how to make the famous savory pastries and a delicious cheesecake.

title: Six Nations: France holds promises with decisive victory against Ireland
subhead: The French, buoyed by the return of Antoine Dupont, convincingly defeated the Irish at the Stade de France (36-14). They have launched their title defense with panache.

title: Canada, France open consulates in Greenland in show of support
Suspected former member of the Kosovo Liberation Army arrested for war crimes
Kimi Onoda, Japan's young minister likened to 'Joan of Arc,' courts the conservative electorate
Trump launches website under his name to buy drugs at reduced prices
How Marine Le Pen changed her defense strategy
Secondhand market booms, challenging luxury industry
Iran's participation in BRICS+ naval drills against South Africa's wishes causes confusion
Michelangelo drawing sells for record $27.2 million at New York auction
Louvre heist: Empress Eugénie's damaged crown will be restored, museum vows
Japan to restart world's biggest nuclear plant
Lore Baudrit, captain of France's Olympic women's hockey team: 'We train like pros, but don't get paid'
European intelligence services adapt to the upheavals of the Trump era
This French territory off the coast of Canada has 'no clear sense of worry' over Trump
subhead: Elected representatives in Saint-Pierre-et-Miquelon, the only French overseas territory in the North Atlantic, home to 6,000 people, aim to deepen ties with their major partner, Canada, amid growing geopolitical tensions with the US.

title: 'Canada, better the 28th EU member than the 51st US state'
subhead: The Canadian prime minister has called for an alliance of middle powers to stand up to the world's great powers. This is a compelling idea, and one that Europe has been pursuing for 60 years, writes Le Monde columnist Pascal Riché.

title: Democracy is fading in Africa as the world looks away
subhead: While global powers covet Africa's natural resources, they have paid little attention to the wave of coups that have swept the continent in recent years.

title: The unresolved contradictions of the Winter Olympics
'Not only is Trump not crazy, but he is dangerous': Historian Laure Murat salutes Minneapolis 'lesson in democracy'
'The Kurds had Western support, especially from the US. That support has now been withdrawn'
